bib.author: MT Adam

bib.abstract: Are we free agents? The free will problem remains one of the great ongoing debates of western philosophy. This paper investigates the Buddha's views on human freedom. It suggests that the Buddha's position is a unique one, implying a negative response to the question of a metaphysically free will but a positive response to the question of moral responsibility and the possibility of human freedom in a spiritual sense.
